New Records: Christian Eriksen became the oldest player with at least four chances created in consecutive European Championship games since Andrea Pirlo in 2012.
Key Match Events: Harry Kane scored for England in the 18th minute.
M. Hjulmand scored a wonder goal for Denmark in the 34th minute.
Pierre-Emile Højbjerg was named the official player of the match for his defensive and attacking contributions.
Pre-Game Insights: George Russell, Mercedes driver, expressed confidence in England's ability to win Euro 2024 before the match.
Post-Match Reflections: Christian Eriksen felt Denmark should have won the game and emphasized the need to win against Serbia.
Gareth Southgate discussed the need for fresh legs and the experimental role of Trent Alexander-Arnold.
Harry Kane acknowledged England's struggles with and without the ball and the need to improve pressure and ball retention.
Kyle Walker highlighted the importance of managing the game in tournament football and acknowledged the need for improvement.
Gareth Southgate has been managing Harry Kane's playing time to keep him fresh for knockout stages, inspired by France's management of Griezmann in the 2018 World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Denmark had more possession (51%) and shots (16) compared to England (49% possession and 12 shots).
England had more dribbles (18) compared to Denmark (6).
Denmark fans out-sang England fans despite being outnumbered three to one.
Others: Group C will be resolved with England vs Slovenia and Denmark vs Serbia, both matches kicking off simultaneously.
